data.title: Only use Physics of JME3
Unclear documentation with Better Character Control
data.body:
Hello,

I was using Better Character Control on a test/practice project, when I ran into a problem.
With Better Character Control, the player is allowed to scale any slope regardless of steepness.

The Walking Character page mentions a method to set the steepness that the character can climb (setMaxSlope()), but that method is for the now deprecated Character Control (not Better Character Control); the method does not exist in Better Character Control, nor is its functionality implemented. 

Is there supposed to be something else which replaces setMaxSlope(), or should Character Control be used?

data.title: Fixes #566 - XML Serialization handles empty buffers properly now.
data.body:
In DOMOutputCapsule Line 765 we're removing the last character (the space).
When we have an empty buffer, the last character isn't present.

- There already were some checks for empty buffers, but not for every buffer. They were implemented as `Math.max(0, buf.length() - 1);`. I changed that to `if (buf.length() > 0)` since that's more easy to understand. 
- I've added `@Override` to any Override.
- I've added the `//remove last space` comment where it was missing so it is consistent and obvious
- I've enclosed the if condition for the IOException in brackets so it's a bit more easily readable. (Since the long exception message looked like a block of multiple lines)

When this PR is approved/merged I will cherry pick this commit to v3.1

data.title: DOMOutputCapsule is unable to serialize empty buffers
data.body:
Hey Guys,
In DOMOutputCapsule Line 765 we're removing the last character (the space).
When we have an empty buffer, the last character isn't present.

There are multiple overloads of write where this occurs so I'll look through them and submit a pull request.

Edit: So a few things I noticed while editing the file:

- There already were some checks for empty buffers, but not for every buffer. They were implemented as `Math.max(0, buf.length() - 1);`. I changed that to `if (buf.length() > 0)` since that's more easy to understand. 
- I've added `@Override` to any Override.
- I've added the `//remove last space` comment where it was missing so it is consistent and obvious
- I've enclosed the if condition for the IOException in brackets so it's a bit more easily readable. (Since the long exception message looked like a block of multiple lines)

data.title: Animation NullPointerException
data.body:
Hello, when I copy code from this tutorial (https://jmonkeyengine.github.io/wiki/jme3/beginner/hello_animation.html), everythink works correctly. But when I change the model from example to my, which I made in Blender, it writes error java.lang.NullPointerException. It is because of:
`control.addListener(this);`
And it is because "control" is null. And it is because prevouris instruction: `control = player.getControl(AnimControl.class);` gives null to variable "control". 
So what is the solution? When I try example code from tutorial, it works correctly, but when I replace the model name(path), it doesn't works. (Path of model is correct, because when I only display my model, it load the model correctly).

data.title: Constructors of SpotLight does not set invSpotRange
data.body:
If the method _SpotLight.setSpotRange(float)_ is called, also the inner value _invSpotRange_ is set. But if one of the constructors of the _SpotLight_ class is used that also provide the _spotRange_ parameter, the inverse range value is not set to the correct value. This leads to some lighting effects in the scene, where the default range of _100f_ is used instead of the value set by the constructor.

To fix this, the internal variable _invSpotRange_ of the _SpotLight_ class has to be set every time, the variable _spotRange_ is set. I whould recommand to simply call _setSpotRange(float)_ from within the constructor.

data.title: Broken Links in Documentation
data.body: This is not a problem with the engine itself, but with the wiki. Many of the links written on the wiki are broken and result in 404 pages. One of these links even loads a page of what appears to be a Chinese Jockey club (the faulty link is the one at the bottom of the 3D rotations doc page which is supposed to link to Transform Matrices). Also, many of the links in the actual content are broken. Even the page on reporting bugs is not updated; it links to the Google code archive instead of Github. This is not a severe issue; I can access what I wanted to see by typing in Google, but it is frustrating and sometimes confusing when the link works, but it points to the wrong page (like in the report bugs link).

data.title: #503 fixed
data.body:
RenderBuffer.getColorBuffer() returns now the color buffer at the index set by setTargetIndex(int), if multiple buffers are available.
This allows Renderer.readFrameBufferWithFormat to read all color buffers, not only the first one.

data.title: Followup to #549: conditional compilation of LWJGL3
data.body:
LWJGL3 is only included int he build process, if the jdk is at least of version 1.8.
The travis build is edited so that it tests against Java7 and Java8.

This is the followup to pull request #549.

data.title: Incomplete draw buffer error on AMD cards
data.body:
This only happens on AMD cards. Two specifically that cause it are the hd6410/5850. I deconverted my project back to 3.0 and it ran fine on both cards. The issue only seems to be present in 3.1

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Incomplete draw buffer.
at com.jme3.renderer.opengl.GLRenderer.checkFrameBufferError(GLRenderer.java:1425)
at com.jme3.renderer.opengl.GLRenderer.updateFrameBuffer(GLRenderer.java:1590)
at com.jme3.renderer.opengl.GLRenderer.setFrameBuffer(GLRenderer.java:1736)
at com.jme3.renderer.RenderManager.renderViewPort(RenderManager.java:1072)
at com.jme3.renderer.RenderManager.render(RenderManager.java:1145)
at com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication.update(SimpleApplication.java:253)
at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.runLoop(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:151)
at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglDisplay.runLoop(LwjglDisplay.java:193)
at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.run(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:232)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

data.title: Fix for MTR Framebuffers
Misterious OpenGL error "Invalid operation (1282)"
data.body:
It seems that when an application that makes use of PBR material is launched with assertion enabled (-ae), at some point,likely when the PBR is rendered, this exception is raised:

```
SEVERE: An OpenGL error has occured!
org.lwjgl.opengl.OpenGLException: Invalid operation (1282)
    at org.lwjgl.opengl.Util.checkGLError(Util.java:59)
    at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.checkGLError(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:136)
    at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.runLoop(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:157)
    at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglDisplay.runLoop(LwjglDisplay.java:197)
    at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.run(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:232)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
```

However, if assertion are disabled, it seems to run without any noticeable issue.

It has been reported also in this thread: [/t/36292](https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/testpbrlighting-openglexception-invalid-operation-1282/36292).

data.title: Removed JmeCloneable interface from LodControl
data.body: It is already implemented in AbstractControl.

data.title: InstancedNode: java.lang.AssertionError when removing a child node
data.body:
In my scene i have one InstancedNode that has as children several nodes, each of them has some geometries inside. 

If i try to  remove one of the child nodes, after the instance() method is called called, the app crashes with this error

```
SEVERE: Uncaught exception thrown in Thread[jME3 Main,5,main]
java.lang.AssertionError
    at com.jme3.scene.GeometryGroupNode.getGeometryStartIndex(GeometryGroupNode.java:13)
    at com.jme3.scene.instancing.InstancedNode.ungroupSceneGraph(InstancedNode.java:273)
    at com.jme3.scene.instancing.InstancedNode.ungroupSceneGraph(InstancedNode.java:265)
    at com.jme3.scene.instancing.InstancedNode.detachChildAt(InstancedNode.java:284)
    at com.jme3.scene.Node.detachChild(Node.java:385)
    at com.jme3.scene.Spatial.removeFromParent(Spatial.java:976)
    at tests.TestInstanceNode.simpleUpdate(TestInstanceNode.java:85)
    at com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication.update(SimpleApplication.java:239)
    at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.runLoop(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:151)
    at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglDisplay.runLoop(LwjglDisplay.java:197)
    at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.run(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:232)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
```

This is the test case: https://gist.github.com/riccardobl/343eb6e659525e179add250421a0842d

If the geometries are attached to the InstancedNode directly (USE_NODE_PARENT=false in the test case), the error doesn't occur.

data.title: Lwjgl3 update from 3.0.0b to 3.0.0
data.body:
This pull request relates to issue #534. The lwjgl version was updated from 3.0.0b to 3.0.0 and all code adaptions were made.

That lwjgl update introduced many API changes, I had to rewrite a lot of the existing code. So please test it, if I missed something. (I tried many tests from the examples project, but only on my system)

data.title: Exception on new Nifty GUI in visual editor
data.body:
Hello,
I am working in the new 3.1 beta1 release, a clean install, and ran into an Exception while using the visual editor on a clean new gui xml file built using the new file wizard. I have put the exception on pastbin: [](http://pastebin.com/ARRVzJRu)

Recreation is easy:
1. File -> New File -> GUI -> Empty GUI
2. Open xml file in editor, then click visual.

Thanks,
Trevor
